conclusion: Determine if accelerations of objects A and B are first increasing and then decreasing between time 0 and t1 by analyzing the slope of their v-t graphs.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time; slope of tangent line on v-t graph gives acceleration.
Observe the slope of the curves for both objects A and B.
Red lines represent tangent lines at different points on the curves of A and B.
For object A, slope of tangent lines increases initially and then decreases.
For object B, slope of tangent lines also increases initially and then decreases.
Both objects A and B show an initial increase in acceleration followed by a decrease in acceleration from 0 to t1.
Final answer: Yes, the accelerations of both objects A and B are first increasing and then decreasing during the time interval from 0 to t1.
